conversations.content: A platoon led by Commander Kirsty has been ordered to hold a base located in a mountainous border region.
Barracks
Looks like we're completely surrounded. Ain't that a kick in the pants?
Joachim? ...JOACHIM! Status report, now!
Hoo boy. She ain't happy.
Yes, Commander! Right away!
I hear we're surrounded by Barthe forces. Is there any chance it's a different army that's trying to fool us into thinking so?
Not likely, ma'am. Their battle standards and uniforms are all of Barthe make, and it's difficult to imagine someone else going to all that trouble.
In another piece of bad news, they appear to have five times our current numbers.
Only Barthe scum would break a truce. Curse them and all their kind!
This was just supposed to be a temporary garrison! We're not equipped for a siege! W-we're doomed! All of us!
Stow that talk! Back to your posts! And in the future, if I want your opinion on a matter, I WILL ASK YOU FOR IT!
Ma'am, yes, ma'am!
Heavy hangs the crown, eh?
A commander cannot tolerate unbridled speculation and panic among her troops. That way lies only anarchy.
Barthe may well be flouting the truce, but we lack the information necessary to conclude that with any confidence.
And besides, the state of the truce has no bearing on our current orders.
Defend the base until the last man?
Exactly. Now then, what do you predict our enemy's next move to be?
Considering their numbers, they'll likely be satisfied with cutting off our supply lines and trying to starve us out.
Though I wouldn't put it past them to poke us from time to time just to remind the men how dire their situation is.
Then how would you defend this base if that is, indeed, their plan?
I wouldn't. If we try to hold it all, they'll ferret out our weak points and pick us apart like crows.
I suggest consolidating our forces in a specific area and defending that.
Interesting. On another note, when can we expect reinforcements?
Messengers have been dispatched, but they'll take some time to arrive. Looks like we'll have to hunker down here for the long haul.
On a more positive note, I requested extra stocks of rations and fresh water from HQ before we left.
Oh? Good thinking.
To be honest, ma'am, I had a bad feeling about this assignment from the start.
It almost makes up for the way you shirked your guard duty after we arrived.
Hey, you're a taskmaster, you know? I can't possibly do everything myself.
I don't recall ordering you to do so.
Not this again... Er, what I mean is, ma'am, maybe you can just let it slide considering our current situation?
It's in my nature to work alone,  and sometimes it gets the best of me.
The ＂lone wolf＂ has long been a convenient excuse for soldiers. That being said, I know we all have our own strengths and weaknesses to contend with.
Exactly, ma'am! Always use the right tool for the job, as they say.
However, you should trust that I will take your ＂nature＂ into account when considering your next assignment. Now then...
Attention, all units! We will establish a defensive perimeter at this location!
Reinforcements are en route! If we stand fast and hold the line, we WILL win the day!
Oh, sure. Just hold the line. Piece of cake...
Joachim!
Yeah?
Determine how much of this base is defensible and assign men to those areas. And if the enemy attacks, make sure they regret that decision.
What?!
Sorry, ma'am, but I thought we'd come to an understanding in terms of how I preferred solo assignments.
You told me to use the right tool for the job, yes? And I can think of no better use for a lone wolf than to round up all of his packmates.
That is not in ANY way what I meant.
That's a rather long-winded way to say ＂Right away, Commander.＂
R-right away, Commander!
Man, she REALLY needs to relax. Maybe take a spa day or something...
Sir, the perimeter has been completed. What are our next orders?
Oh? In that case, stand down for now. I'll take care of things from here.
You sure that's advisable, sir?
Don't worry about it. With me on guard, not even a mouse will be able to break through this perimeter.
In that case, some rest will be welcome. Me and the boys are exhausted.
Stay frosty, sir!
Yeah, yeah. Get outta here already.
Thank hell THAT'S over. This whole ＂giving orders＂ thing really ain't for me.
Anyway, the perimeter looks solid, so now we just whittle and whistle until the cavalry arrives.
It's gonna be tough with so few troops, but we'll just have to make it work. Can't let Kirsty down, after all.
Still, until there's actually an enemy waving a sword in my face, there's no harm in kicking my feet up and... Huh?
Enemy forces incoming from the north! Everyone to your stations!
Attacking in the middle of the night, eh? Looks like this is gonna be rough for both sides.
Awaiting your orders, sir!
I tell ya, sometimes a guy just can't catch a break... Er, understood, soldier! I'm on my way!
Svenitlan Base - Northern Side
CHAAAAAARGE!
Surrender, Svenitlan dogs!
N-not a chance! We'll hold out until...
Sorry! Sorry! I'm here! Right then. Have at thee and...so forth.
Argh!
Let's go! Plenty of me to go around...
He's a monster... Retreat! Retreeeeeeat!
*sigh* What a mess. Still, looks like we pushed 'em back for the moment.
Joachim! The enemy is advancing!
We can't hold them!
Oh, for the love of... This is too much.
Meanwhile, at the south side of the Svenitlan base...
Heh heh. Nice! I should be able to sneak in while they're distracted.
Harrrgh!
Right then! Looks like the attacks are finally starting to let up.
Everyone, come quickly! The storehouse is on fire!
Oh, you sneaky devils...
Storehouse
Hurry! Put it out before we lose all of our supplies!
Tsk. Well, this ain't good.
Damage report, Joachim?
Fire in the storehouse destroyed more than half our rations.
Then the assault from the north was a mere diversion? Hmm. Impressive.
I'm sorry, Commander. I should have been more vigilant.
How long do you intend to run?
Sorry?
If you had ordered the troops to maintain a proper lookout, the saboteur would have been spotted sooner.
...Understood, ma'am.
I won't speak ill of those who stand courageous in the face of adversity, even if they fail.
But I will ALSO not tolerate failure that stems from the refusal of a soldier to face their own flaws. Such are cravens, and I have no use for cravens.
If you make the same mistake again, the punishment will be swift and severe. Am I understood?
Yes, ma'am.
And you there! In the corner! Show yourself.
Noelle?! How in the hell...?
Er, there's a tunnel.
Wait, we've had a tunnel this whole time? Who even MADE it?
Uh, I don't know? But an engineer told me about it some time ago. She, uh, said it was an escape tunnel.
But it's all narrow and...um...crumbly. So no one uses it.
Is it safe to say that very few people know about this tunnel?
*nod*
If you used it to get here, that must mean it comes out beyond the enemy's camp.
Which means WE can use it to escape this deathtrap.
Negative. Everyone is to remain here and await reinforcements.
Right. Of course. Silly me... Well then, what brings you to our little slice of heaven, Noelle?
Actually, I have a message...
...So higher-ups were captured on their way back from negotiating an armistice with Barthe and are in need of rescue?
Y-yes.
It would seem there is a faction within Barthe that finds the truce unfavorable.
Probably the same faction that's breathing down our damn necks right now.
What would your move be, Joachim? Would you attempt to rescue the captives, or leave them to fend for themselves?
Normally, I'd be more than happy to rescue some big shots and bask in the glory, but we've barely got the forces to hold this base as it is.
I hate to say it—especially since a lot of this is my fault—but I think we need to leave 'em to their own devices.
Agreed. A rescue attempt is simply too great a risk at this time.
Oh...dear.
I haven't finished.
Having said that, if we DID succeed in this rescue, it may be possible to preserve the truce and avoid further bloodshed.
D-does that mean...?
Now is the time for justice. ...Joachim!
Ma'am!
I'm assigning a squad to your command. Do what must be done.
Sorry, did you say a SQUAD?
I have no one else I can trust with this assignment. Rest assured that I will oversee the defense of this base in your absence, however.
You can do this, Joachim. I have faith in you.
Kirsty, I...
What are your orders, soldier?!
Ma'am! I am to command a squad and rescue individuals crucial to our cause!
Er, um, if you need to know where everyone is, I can...guide you?
Excellent. Now move out!
Yes, Commander!
A squad under Joachim's command has been tasked with rescuing a team of negotiators. With Noelle's assistance, they manage to cross the border and infiltrate Barthe.
At a forest near the Barthe border...
So, um, over there. The negotiators are being held in that camp.
Damn. It's guarded tighter than a henhouse in fox country.
What should we do, sir?
(What SHOULD we do? Split into two, maybe?)
(One group can act as a decoy to draw their forces, while the other sneaks in and rescues the captives.)
(Nah, that's no good.)
(If they see through the plan, it'll mean I sent everyone to their deaths.)
(I can't have that.)
(It'd be my sister all over again...)
...chim! ...achim!
Hey! Joachim!
Yeah?
Stop starin' into space and DO something already!
Sir, are you feeling all right? You look a bit pale.
Yeah, I'm fine.
Aw, to hell with it. Looks like the only option is to charge in directly!
My life is in your hands!
(Well, hell. If I don't give an order soon, they're all gonna end up dead anyway.)
(Dammit. My hands won't stop shaking.)
(They're all going to die...)
Prepare for battle! We move as one!
S-stop!
What now?
Just wait a second. I have a plan.
(I can't sit by and watch them die. I won't lose anyone else—never again!)
Barthe Base
Captain! Our scouts report that a large Svenitlan force is approaching!
Come for the hostages, no doubt. Prepare a counterattack.
Wait!
Yes? What is it?
Please forgive my breach of protocol, sir, but shouldn't we consider the possibility that this could be a diversion?
Explain yourself.
Our borders are sealed tight, sir. It stretches the boundaries of logic to think a large force could have snuck up on us unseen.
A valid point. Which would mean...
They plan to draw our attention with this charade, then steal the hostages out from under our noses!
We need more intelligence before making a decision one way or the other.
Shall we move the hostages to the innermost part of the camp to be safe?
Do it. These fools will soon learn Barthe is not so easily deceived as all that!
Captain!
What is it, soldier? Did you find the Svenitlan army?
Just a few stragglers in the woods, sir.
Then it IS a diversion! They'll surely attempt to infiltrate our camp soon, so increase security around the hostages.
Uh, regarding that, sir. The hostages seem to have...um...escaped.
WHAT?!
Ha ha ha! I can't believe we pulled it off!
Joachim's strategy worked like a charm!
I never would've come up with that. You really pulled the wool over their eyes!
It's all of you who deserve the credit. Thanks for trusting my orders.
(Phew! The plan worked. Maybe now I can get back in Kirsty's good graces.)
Right then. Let's use the tunnel and... Huh?
Why is Noelle running toward us?
*pant* *pant*
What's the rush, Noelle?
The Barthe army has mounted a full offensive on the mountain base!
Damn. They were short-handed enough BEFORE our squad departed.
(It'll take too much time for us to crawl back through that tiny tunnel...)
(Dammit! I have to help Kirsty!)
Joachim!
What?
We need a plan here! How are we going to rescue the commander?
We'll do whatever it takes, sir! Please give your orders!
Guys, I don't...
(Wait. That's it.)
Right! Forget the tunnel—we're going to cross the border and engage the enemy in a direct frontal assault!
Yes, sir!
That's what I like to hear! To arms, men! To arms!
(We WILL make it in time!)
We're about to lose the sun.
Commander! Enemy troops are approaching from the cliffside path!
They're also moving up the mountain path on the other side of the camp! We can't possibly hold them all off!
Destroy the path by the cliffs. Force them onto the mountain path.
Cover the mountain path in stones just large enough to impede their march.
Move the injured deeper into the base. We'll reduce our perimeter and tighten our defenses.
Yes, ma'am!
(The wolf's jaws close around us. Should I have ignored the rescue?)
(...No. Defending this base is meaningless if the only hope for lasting peace is lost.)
(There was never a real choice here.)
Svenitlan Base - Southern Side
Die!
Urk!
Get back! I'll take your place!
D-damn it all... There's so many of 'em!
It all comes down to this moment. Time for me to join the front lines!
Stay back, Commander! I'll go in your stead!
Not with those wounds. Stay here, soldier. I will command the front directly.
Haaah!
Wha—?!
Push them back!
Commander?! I mean, yes, ma'am! All forces, to me!
Damn! The tides are turning... Fall back! Fall baaack!
(We've held them off, but fatigue is starting to take its toll.)
(If Joachim and the others can just return in time...)
(Where could he BE?)
Ma'am! Possible reinforcements sighted!
Is that you, Joachim?
I'll confirm the report, ma'am! Wait, is that...?
Rout the Svenitlan dogs!
...Ma'am, it's a Barthe soldier. These are ENEMY reinforcements.
They've got MORE soldiers?! Oh, we're done for! It's all over!
(Perhaps I've seen my last sun this day.)
(Still, we will fight to the last.)
Fight on, all of you! Let them taste fear! Let them know sorrow! Let the very name of Svenitla haunt them to their graves!
Barthe Camp
Reinforcements have arrived!
Then the base is nearly ours!
Er, wait. Hang on. I actually don't remember calling FOR reinforcements. What unit are you with, anyway?
Hurk! Wh...why...?
Damn. This armor sure ain't light.
Treacherous cowards!
Well, that seems a bit harsh. Regardless, it's time to exact revenge!
Commander! The enemy is breaking rank! It's a full-on mutiny!
Mutiny? That seems highly unlikely...
Oh, of course! It's Joachim! Ha! Well played, you old dog! Still, I can't let you steal our glory.
Hear me, men! Our ally's sneak attack has thrown the enemy into disarray!
Victory is within our reach! We must endure!
We did it, Commander! The enemy is retreating!
We survived!
Closer than I'd like, but yes.
Kirsty!
Joachim! Was the rescue a success?
It sure was.
All thanks to Joachim's strategy, ma'am!
Oh? Tell me of this strategy.
Joachim snuck into their encampment disguised as a Barthe soldier!
He tricked their captain into moving the hostages to a safer location, and we moved them all the way out of camp! Ha!
Hmm. Cunning indeed.
You've done well to return in one piece. I commend your bravery.
Kirsty...
Remain resolute, all of you! Reinforcements are nearly here!
*yawn*
If you are bored, I'm happy to find something for you to do.
I dunno. Somehow I just haven't felt very motivated since we got back.
But YOU'VE certainly been busy.
You went from battling our enemies  to battling a mountain of paperwork.
All part of my charge.
Well, I'll be sure to avoid promotions at all cost.
Honestly, why are you even here? You were granted leave days ago.
Guess I couldn't bear to leave your side.
Easy, there! Just a joke, is all. I'll get out of your hair if you want.
Joachim, listen to me.
Ma'am?
You saved my life. I won't forget it. Thank you.
Hey, whoa. This isn't like you at all.
Frankly, I didn't save you so much as nearly ruin everything and then figure out how to pull my butt out of the fire.
Enough with the false modesty. Without your little surprise attack, I wouldn't be standing here today.
So if you won't use your leave, I'll have to reward you myself. Anything strike your fancy?
Oh, nothing in particular. Except, well...maybe a kiss from a lady?
You are out of line, soldier!
Heh. Figured as much.
...At least, that's what I'd normally say.
Close your eyes.
Whoa, wait! Is this happening?! 'Cause I was mostly—
Do you want your reward or not?
Y-yes, ma'am! Eyes are closed, ma'am!
(I can't believe this is going to happen... I wasn't even serious!)
...Ma'am? Is that sound what I think it is?
It's...a mountain of paperwork.
Precisely. Your reward is to assist with all of this.
Hoo boy.
Separate out the important documents so I can look them over. For everything else, just forge my signature.
That's against regulations, ma'am!
You let me worry about that. Now get to work before you lose the sun!
Yes, ma'am!
Ugh. I'm halfway through, but there's still so much paperwork to go.
Do not stay your hand, Joachim.
Yes, ma'am!
My shoulders are a bit stiff.
One military-grade back rub, coming up.
I'm ever so parched.
*sigh* Guess I'll make some coffee.
Black as night, and strong enough to float a gold piece on the top.
Your usual then? Coming up.
Hmm. My stomach is rumbling.
Er, I think I have some leftover salami in my rations?
Unacceptable! I need a hot meal in order to maintain my focus!
Fine, I'll throw something together. How's deer soup sound?
Acceptable.
Joachim! I am finished!
*siiigh* Me too. Somehow. 'Course, my fingers might pop off and run away at any moment...
Hmm. This was most efficient. We'll use this method for all paperwork going forward.
Uh, does that mean I'll be the one in the barrel every time?
Of course! Now let's get going.
MORE work?
You have a dog to walk. It's part of your daily routine, yes?
Oh. Right.
I'll join you—unless you'd prefer I didn't?
No, no. I don't mind.
Then let's be off!
Yes, ma'am!
Good girl! Your coat is beautiful!
Just brushed her yesterday.
I see you're taking good care of her.
Yeah, sure.
She is your sister's dog, after all.
It has been seven years, Joachim. Surely she would want you to move on after all this time.
Please, ma'am. Just...stop. I don't want to talk about it.
You're not family, so it doesn't concern you.
I...I see. My apologies.
No, don't apologize. I'm the one at fault.
Er, is that everyone's favorite messenger?
Commander Kirsty! I have urgent orders from HQ!
Well, this is sooner than expected. Hand them over.
...Yes, I see. As expected, what happened at the border was only the beginning.
Joachim?
Ma'am?
Muster the troops immediately. Leave will have to be cut short. We have much to accomplish.
Can't be worse than paperwork!
